title: REVIEW --- Play: News Quiz
text:
B. Tim Hortons

C. Continental Mills

D. General Mills

---

2. Whose old stores are being used as Covid-19 vaccination centers?

A. Blockbuster

B. Montgomery Ward

C. Sears

D. E.J. Korvettes

---

3. Iran said it resumed enriching uranium to 20% purity. What's the level of enrichment for weapons-grade uranium?

A. 20%

B. 30%

C. 50%

D. 90%

---

4. Mondelez agreed to buy Hu Master Holdings, valued at $340 million. What's special about Hu's chocolate bars?

A. They're based on a paleolithic diet.

B. They're Internet connected.

C. They're made with grasshoppers.

D. They're cocoa-free.

---

5. A violent mob invaded the Capitol, forcing the evacuation of congressional leaders -- to which destination?

A. Fort McHenry

B. Fort McNair

C. Fort Sumter

D. Fort Totten

---

6. A start-up wants to provide a la carte entertainment streaming from a variety of services without the need to subscribe to each. What's it called?

A. Flomax

B. Struum

C. Chooz

D. Graze

---

7. Amazon, Berkshire Hathaway and JPMorgan ended their Haven joint venture. What was its long-shot goal?

A. Lower health care costs

B. Cheaper high-speed internet

C. Landing a colony on Mars

D. Local journalism that pays for itself

---

8. Victories in Georgia by Jon Ossoff and Raphael Warnock gave Democrats control of the U.S. Senate. Who'd they beat?

A. Kelly Lange and Frank Perdue

B. Kelly Loeffler and David Perdue

C. Kelly O'Hara and John Purdue

D. Kelly Perdew and James Laughlin

---

9. Which standout wide receiver won the Heisman Trophy?

A. Ja'Marr Chase

B. Jaylen Waddle

C. Fred Biletnikoff

D. DeVonta Smith

---

ANSWERS

1. C

2. C

3. D

4. A

5. B

6. B

7. A

8. B

9. D
